articles.title: 10,000 more cancer deaths predicted because of COVID-19 pandemic - NBC News
articles.description: Cancer doctor says the COVID-19 pandemic will lead to an increase of 10,000 deaths from breast and colorectal cancers over the next decade.
articles.content: One of the nation's leading voices on cancer predicts the number of people who will die from breast or colorectal cancer in the U.S. will increase by nearly 10,000 over the next decade because of COV… [+3257 chars]

articles.title: Mosquito, Tick Populations Unchecked Amid COVID-19 - WebMD
articles.description: Health departments are pouring resources into easing the coronavirus and have been forced to limit or suspend pest services
articles.content:
In 2019, there were more cases of EEE -- a potentially deadly virus spread by mosquitoes -- reported in the U.S. than in any year since 1959.

articles.author: Tiffini Theisen
articles.title: Florida coronavirus: 89,748 cases, 3,104 deaths - Orlando Sentinel
articles.description: Florida reported an additional 3,822 coronavirus cases Friday, yet another record-shattering increase as the number of infections statewide approaches 90,000.
